definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: No junketing activity would be conducted on official expenses without permission of the company.
sentences.chinese: 在未得到公司授权情况下，不得以公费进行宴请活动。

sentences.english: Great River mostly at public expense, so new students is good.
sentences.chinese: 江大大多都是公费，所以生源还是不错的。

sentences.english: I wish I could be sent abroad to study at government expense.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我能被派到国外公费留学。

sentences.english: This item of expenditure belongs under the head of office expenses.
sentences.chinese: 这项开支应列在办公费项下。

sentences.english: Last year, sightseeing tours at public expense.
sentences.chinese: 去年警告公费观光旅游。

sentences.english: He has never taken a government-paid junket .
sentences.chinese: 他从来没有公费旅游过。

sentences.english: I wonder why the civil servants of the local government have the rights for free medical service.
sentences.chinese: 我想知道为什么当地政府里的公务员享受公费医疗。

sentences.english: Law Master also has at public expense at one's own expenses.
sentences.chinese: 法学硕士有公费也有自费。

sentences.english: We also provide opportunities to visit and learn abroad every year.
sentences.chinese: 并且每年为员工提供公费出国参观考察的机会。

sentences.english: The answer seems to be a lot of time spent talking-as well as the odd junket.
sentences.chinese: 答案似乎应该是大量的交流探讨和古怪的公费旅游。

sentences.english: Article 30 Officers shall enjoy free medical care.
sentences.chinese: 第三十条军官享受公费医疗待遇。

sentences.english: I wish I could be sent abroad to study at the Government's expense.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我能被派到国外公费留学。

sentences.english: Workers shall enjoy free medical treatment.
Another change is that medical expenses are being covered less and less.
sentences.chinese: 另外一个变化就是公费医疗所涵盖的越来越少。

sentences.english: Objective To explore the causes and methods of social medicine overtaking situation of Guangdong Province university.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨广东高校公费医疗超支的原因及对策。

sentences.english: He put the telephone bill down as a business cost.
sentences.chinese: 他把电话费用作为办公费记下。

definition: to send sb abroad at the government's expense
to join the faculty of one's alma mater upon graduation/to remain at school during vacation
to transfer (from production to other duties)/to take leave (for study or other job)/to dispose of property/to transfer assets (to avoid liability)
to go abroad/to leave the country/emigration
to receive one's regular salary (while on vacation, study leave etc)/paid (leave)/on full pay
to be reimbursed for actual expenses
